p: Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) emerged quickly after introduction of the first semi-synthetic Î²-lactam in 1961 and has become a major worldwide health care problem [ 2]. Due to the rapidity and extent of its spread, as well as the high diversity among clones and strain virulence, the WHO has classified MRSA as a high priority target for new antibiotic development [ 4].
